N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 14-3.15 - Postweld heat treatment

State Regulations
(a) General. In repairing carbon or low alloy steels, postweld heat treatment shall
be required if it would be required for new construction by the ASME Code. Under certain conditions, postweld heat treatment as outlined in this
subdivision may be inadvisable or impractical. In these instances, any other
method of postweld heat treatment or special welding method acceptable to the
inspector may be used. (b) Peening. In lieu of postweld heat treatment of carbon steels, peening or other methods
acceptable to the inspector may be used. Notes
